info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 13 at 10:06PM EDT until May 14 at 2:30PM EDT by NWS State College PA
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania...
Youghiogheny River near Confluence affecting Somerset County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Youghiogheny River near Confluence.
* WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, The Youghiogheny Reservoir is expected to begin curtailing releases due to high water downstream of the dam. River interests are encouraged to monitor conditions in their vicinity and to be prepared if further rises occur. At 12.0 feet, The right bank of the river overflows downstream of confluence and about 1/4 mile upstream from the gaging station. At 14.0 feet, State Route 3003 is closed due to high water. High water covers the road about one tenth of a mile downstream of the confluence of the Casselman and Youghiogheny Rivers.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 11.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 12.9 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued by 7:00am.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON
